p: “Pompia” is the popular name of a peculiar Sardinian Citrus ecotype, whose main area of cultivation is historically identified in the Baronia region, in the Middle-Eastern area of Sardinia island (Italy) [ 1]. Nowadays, however, its production has spread all over the island [ 2]. Its very thick albedo is used in the confectionery industry and consumed as both a candied dessert (“sa pompìa intrea”) and the main ingredient of a traditional fruit-cake (“s’aranzata”) [ 3].
